resources.string:
Alarm pattern may include following characters:
(s)hort = 0.5s
(m)edium = 1s
(l)ong = 1.5s
(e)xtra long = 2s
(c)onstant = constantly on
To set custom pattern remove (c)onstant character first.
The following issue appeared after I took these steps:

1. Click on a label to view a hint. 
2. Click on an icon to play the pattern you entered in [3]. 
3. Enter pattern for vibration or flash. For instance entering "smle" for vibration would produce (s)hort, (m)edium, (l)ong and (e)xtra long bursts of vibration which repeats once alarm is triggered. Entering "c" would remove entire pattern and stands for (c)onstant on for both vibration and flash light. 
4. Digital picker allows entering digits in Alarm Settings when setting up alarm time. When off, digital time picker is replaced with analog watch face.

1. Add new alarm 
2. Alarm time. Shows in 24 or 12 hour format depending on your phone settings. 
3. Click and hold anywhere within active alarm to delete it. 
4. Icons left to right indicate whether vibration, flashlight or rising volume are set up. 
5. To disable alarm tap ON button. Unless Repeat Weekly is set in Alarm Settings, alarm will get disabled automatically after all of this week's alarms got triggered.

1. Tap to return to Active Alarms. Current alarm is not saved. 
2. Delete current alarm. Helpful if alarm is already in Active Alarms. Otherwise equivalent to [1]. 
3. Save alarm and return to Active Alarms. 
4. Additional Settings and other menu items available there. 
5. Tapping on time allows to set alarm time. Digital or analog time picker can be set in Additional Settings. 
6. Press to play current alarm. Alarm tone must be set first. Plays at the level set in [7] or gradually increases volume if Rising volume is set in [8]. 
7. Changes volume if Rising volume is not set. Setting to the lowest level equivalent to choosing Silent for Alarm Tone. 
8. Utilize available hardware to make alarm more noticeable. Custom vibration and flashlight patterns are available in [4]'s Additional Settings. 
9. Pressing phone back key is equivalent to tapping 3 and saving alarm.
